summary: 31 days of andi mack
body:
31 days of andi mack

how i started watching

okay so i had originally watched a video about new shows coming to disney channel and it talked about andi mack, and to be honest I thought it looked dumb at first but fast forward to months later i was on youtube and saw the first episode on disney’s channel. I was obsessed immediately and stole my aunts xfinity and watched season one and impatiently waited for season two. The end.

summary: 31 Days of Andi Mack
body:
31 Days of Andi Mack

How did you find out about Andi Mack, why did you start watching it, and why did you join the fandom?

I found out about Andi Mack through all the publicity it was getting when it first started. I was kind of excited to see what Disney would do with it.

I didn’t really care that much about it at first. I watched an episode or two, but I wasn’t invested. Until, one day, I was lying in bed not paying attention to my TV when all of the sudden Cyrus was confessing his feelings for Jonah. I was obsessed after that.

I joined the fandom because I started shipping Jyrus, and I wanted to be a part of the conversation. Then, I started writing Tyrus fan fiction.

blog.name: rainbowshipping
blog.title: Sligthly Obssessed With A Disney Channel Show
blog.description:
Former Andi Mack Blog now an official Libby Stan Blog

Talk to me about Niris, Ambi, Walrus, and Monah.

Where did Andi’s scooter go? Did it disappear just like my hopes and dreams. Join me in my efforts to spread the good word about Monah.

Jyrus or Tyrus? I think you mean Niris or Ambi.

Kip runs a Tyrus blog and no one can convince me otherwise.

Nobody in this show is straight despite what the Disney propagandists may tell you

summary:
Buffy and Marty meet again. Buffy says she has a boyfriend now to which Marty replies: me too.
And guess what!
It's the blonde...
body:
Buffy and Marty meet again. Buffy says she has a boyfriend now to which Marty replies: me too.

And guess what!

It’s the blonde biker.

tags: i was found: wigless after the promo
summary: you know what?
body:
you know what?

this is how i think tj is gonna say he likes cyrus:

so, y'all saw the scene in the promo where tj is in the cafeteria (is it said like that in english?) and he looks up with a kinda disappointed look in his eyes, and there’s also a scene where cyrus looks kinda the same? well, it’s pretty obvious there is some tension between them. so, not trying to make this so long, i think cyrus will try to talk to him but tj will, like, distance himself from him, but cyrus won’t give up and will ask him like why is he ignoring him or something like that, but tj will keep not answering bUT he’s gonna like explode in some point and will shout him something like: “because i like you!” or “because i was jelous” and there will be like a moment of silence and they will leave it like a cliffhanger until the next episode. that’s it.

idk if i explained my thought clearly because my first language is spanish but i tried, lol

tags: idk this feels kinda messy and not done well jskdk
this was also long asf lol about 1200 words rip
summary: Part 2 of my promo fic \o/
body:
Part 2 of my promo fic \o/

Read the first part here !! This part deals with that angsty exchange of looks we saw in the cafeteria :-)))

**********

This felt like the longest day ever. Cyrus’ eyes were fixed on the clock that was mounted above the whiteboard. 11:25 AM. Ugh, more than a half an hour left until he was able to talk to TJ. Cyrus had texted TJ multiple times that morning, but there was no reply. This only made Cyrus even more anxious about the whole situation.

“Goodman.”

It actually kind of hurt him that TJ was so hesitant to talk to him. He thought they’ve gotten to the point in their friendship where they could pretty much talk about anything. But apparently not, he guessed?

“GOODMAN!”

Cyrus was brought back to reality by the booming sound of his Literature teacher’s voice. Cyrus heard soft giggles around him and realised he’d been spacing out.

“Do me a favour, quit daydreaming and read paragraph 4, will you?” he crossed his arms and raised his eyebrows. Cyrus blinked a couple times, tried to find said paragraph, and did as he was told.

The lunch bell rang after what felt like an eternity, and Cyrus rushed out of the classroom to his locker. He stuffed books in, pulled other books out and practically ran to the cafeteria. He stood and scanned the entire cafeteria until his eyes stopped at a bright aquamarine shirt. TJ was sitting at a table by himself, and had his head down. Cyrus watched him with a pained expression for a few seconds, until TJ looked up and made eye contact. TJ’s breath hitched when he saw Cyrus approaching his table. He looked back down when Cyrus took a seat.

“Hey,” Cyrus said quietly.

“Hey…” TJ responded solemnly.

There was a good minute or so of silence, until TJ finally spoke up.

“How do you know Caleb?” TJ didn’t look up.

“He was in my History class last year. He was the only person I really talked to in that class,” Cyrus explained, watching TJ carefully. TJ hummed in response. He was eventually going to come out to Cyrus, but he didn’t want it to be like this. He wanted to come out to him when he was completely ready, but Caleb came along and ruined everything. TJ sighed and decided there was nothing that could be done about it, except move forward. TJ looked up at Cyrus and shrugged.

“Well, I guess you know now. I’m gay, and Caleb and I used to date,” TJ started. “I’m sorry he put you in that awkward situation, with him thinking that you were my ‘new boyfriend’ and whatever. I mean, I get it if you might not wanna hang out with me anymore…I know-“

“TJ,” Cyrus interrupted him. “First of all, why would I want to stop hanging out with you? You’re one of my best friends.” Cyrus got up from the opposite side of the table and sat beside his taller friend.

“And second of all,” Cyrus softly added, “I’m gay, too.”

TJ’s mouth dropped open, but he wasn’t able to get any words out. Cyrus put his hand on TJ’s shoulder and smiled. The basketball player’s open mouth transformed into a sweet smile and he almost looked like he was about to cry.

“So, tell me. What did Caleb even mean when he said I’d be a ‘better boyfriend than he was’?” Cyrus lifted one leg over the bench and turned to face TJ more.

“Caleb was a straight up asshole. We only dated for like two months, and it was great during the first month, but out of nowhere he just started acting like a completely different person,” TJ began his rant.

“Wait, before you tell me why he was an asshole, tell me about the great first month,” Cyrus rested his elbow on the table and smiled. TJ slightly blushed. He definitely wasn’t expecting to talk about his love life with his crush. That just wasn’t supposed to happen.

“W-well, he was always really nice to me, and even though we kept everything lowkey, he still took me out to some really nice places. He was really into astronomy. I remember one time we went to a planetarium together and he would tell me about all the different planets and constellations. I remember going to his grandmother’s house in the countryside and just lying in the grass with him at night, and watching the stars. Wow, sorry this is so gross, hahaha,” TJ realised how much he was rambling. Cyrus had the cutest smile on his face and said, “No, keep going. That sounds amazing.” TJ blushed again and softly chuckled.

“Well it was amazing, not gonna lie. But after that first month, he stopped taking me out. He kinda took really long to reply to my messages, and he always made excuses when I tried to take him out,” TJ’s eyes were fixed on the ant that was crawling across the table. “I remember trying to check his Instagram once, but I found out that he blocked me. I was so confused. I stopped him in the hallway one day to ask him what was going on. Then, another guy walked up to us and kissed him on the cheek. Turned out that he was cheating on me and just decided to find another guy without even having the decency to break up with me first,” TJ’s heart started to beat faster as the feelings of anger and humiliation were beginning to seep in.

“What??? That’s terrible…I’m so sorry he did that to you,” Cyrus placed his hand on TJ’s leg in comfort. TJ turned his head to look at Cyrus and smiled pitifully.

“Yeah…that’s pretty much the reason why I turned into ‘scary-basketball-guy,’” TJ laughed. “I was so deeply hurt that I felt as if I needed to build walls around me so it wouldn’t happen again. I turned into this tough mean guy who everyone was scared of, and while that had its advantages, I still felt really lonely,” TJ sighed, “Until I met you.”

“Wait, what…?” Cyrus stared at TJ with a surprised look. TJ realised what he got himself into. He was about to confess. Well, here goes nothing.

“Uh, well, ever since we became friends, I felt those walls slowly breaking down. I felt that I could be more open around you. I wanted to be around you more and more. And then I realised,” TJ gulped, “that I liked you…more than a friend.”

Cyrus took a couple seconds to register this information, and shook his head.

“Wait…you…like me?” Cyrus couldn’t believe what was happening.

“Yeah.” TJ glanced at Cyrus and could feel the heat in his face.

“That’s crazy…I never thought you’d actually like me back,” Cyrus said sheepishly.

“Like you…back??” TJ slowly turned around in his seat to face Cyrus.

Cyrus softly laughed and took one of TJ’s hands in his.

“Yes,” Cyrus looked TJ in the eye, “and I’d definitely try to be a boyfriend who’s a thousand times better than that Caleb…Well, o-only if you want, of course.”

TJ felt the anger from talking about Caleb blossom into the happiest and warmest feeling he’s felt in a while. TJ smiled widely and held Cyrus’ hand with both of his.

“More than anything.”

The bell signaling the end of lunch rang, and the two boys realised they didn’t even get anything to eat. They laughed, got up from the table and made their way to a vending machine, hand in hand.

“Well it was amazing, not gonna lie. But after that first month, he stopped taking me out. He kinda took really long to reply to my messages, and he always made excuses when I tried to take him out,” TJ’s eyes were fixed on the ant that was crawling across the table. “I remember trying to check his Instagram once, but I found out that he blocked me. I was so confused. I stopped him in the hallway one day to ask him what was going on. Then, another guy walked up to us and kissed him on the cheek. Turned out that he was cheating on me and just decided to find another guy without even having the decency to break up with me first,” TJ’s heart started to beat faster as the feelings of anger and humiliation were beginning to seep in.

“What??? That’s terrible…I’m so sorry he did that to you,” Cyrus placed his hand on TJ’s leg in comfort. TJ turned his head to look at Cyrus and smiled pitifully.

“Yeah…that’s pretty much the reason why I turned into ‘scary-basketball-guy,’” TJ laughed. “I was so deeply hurt that I felt as if I needed to build walls around me so it wouldn’t happen again. I turned into this tough mean guy who everyone was scared of, and while that had its advantages, I still felt really lonely,” TJ sighed, “Until I met you.”

“Wait, what…?” Cyrus stared at TJ with a surprised look. TJ realised what he got himself into. He was about to confess. Well, here goes nothing.

“Uh, well, ever since we became friends, I felt those walls slowly breaking down. I felt that I could be more open around you. I wanted to be around you more and more. And then I realised,” TJ gulped, “that I liked you…more than a friend.”

Cyrus took a couple seconds to register this information, and shook his head.

“Wait…you…like me?” Cyrus couldn’t believe what was happening.

“Yeah.” TJ glanced at Cyrus and could feel the heat in his face.

“That’s crazy…I never thought you’d actually like me back,” Cyrus said sheepishly.

“Like you…back??” TJ slowly turned around in his seat to face Cyrus.

Cyrus softly laughed and took one of TJ’s hands in his.

“Yes,” Cyrus looked TJ in the eye, “and I’d definitely try to be a boyfriend who’s a thousand times better than that Caleb…Well, o-only if you want, of course.”

TJ felt the anger from talking about Caleb blossom into the happiest and warmest feeling he’s felt in a while. TJ smiled widely and held Cyrus’ hand with both of his.

“More than anything.”

The bell signaling the end of lunch rang, and the two boys realised they didn’t even get anything to eat. They laughed, got up from the table and made their way to a vending machine, hand in hand.
trail.content:
Part 2 of my promo fic \o/

Read the first part here !! This part deals with that angsty exchange of looks we saw in the cafeteria :-)))

**********

This felt like the longest day ever. Cyrus’ eyes were fixed on the clock that was mounted above the whiteboard. 11:25 AM. Ugh, more than a half an hour left until he was able to talk to TJ. Cyrus had texted TJ multiple times that morning, but there was no reply. This only made Cyrus even more anxious about the whole situation.

“Goodman.”

It actually kind of hurt him that TJ was so hesitant to talk to him. He thought they’ve gotten to the point in their friendship where they could pretty much talk about anything. But apparently not, he guessed?

“GOODMAN!”

Cyrus was brought back to reality by the booming sound of his Literature teacher’s voice. Cyrus heard soft giggles around him and realised he’d been spacing out.

“Do me a favour, quit daydreaming and read paragraph 4, will you?” he crossed his arms and raised his eyebrows. Cyrus blinked a couple times, tried to find said paragraph, and did as he was told.

The lunch bell rang after what felt like an eternity, and Cyrus rushed out of the classroom to his locker. He stuffed books in, pulled other books out and practically ran to the cafeteria. He stood and scanned the entire cafeteria until his eyes stopped at a bright aquamarine shirt. TJ was sitting at a table by himself, and had his head down. Cyrus watched him with a pained expression for a few seconds, until TJ looked up and made eye contact. TJ’s breath hitched when he saw Cyrus approaching his table. He looked back down when Cyrus took a seat.

“Hey,” Cyrus said quietly.

“Hey…” TJ responded solemnly.

There was a good minute or so of silence, until TJ finally spoke up.

“How do you know Caleb?” TJ didn’t look up.

“He was in my History class last year. He was the only person I really talked to in that class,” Cyrus explained, watching TJ carefully. TJ hummed in response. He was eventually going to come out to Cyrus, but he didn’t want it to be like this. He wanted to come out to him when he was completely ready, but Caleb came along and ruined everything. TJ sighed and decided there was nothing that could be done about it, except move forward. TJ looked up at Cyrus and shrugged.

“Well, I guess you know now. I’m gay, and Caleb and I used to date,” TJ started. “I’m sorry he put you in that awkward situation, with him thinking that you were my ‘new boyfriend’ and whatever. I mean, I get it if you might not wanna hang out with me anymore…I know-“

“TJ,” Cyrus interrupted him. “First of all, why would I want to stop hanging out with you? You’re one of my best friends.” Cyrus got up from the opposite side of the table and sat beside his taller friend.

“And second of all,” Cyrus softly added, “I’m gay, too.”

TJ’s mouth dropped open, but he wasn’t able to get any words out. Cyrus put his hand on TJ’s shoulder and smiled. The basketball player’s open mouth transformed into a sweet smile and he almost looked like he was about to cry.

“So, tell me. What did Caleb even mean when he said I’d be a ‘better boyfriend than he was’?” Cyrus lifted one leg over the bench and turned to face TJ more.

“Caleb was a straight up asshole. We only dated for like two months, and it was great during the first month, but out of nowhere he just started acting like a completely different person,” TJ began his rant.

“Wait, before you tell me why he was an asshole, tell me about the great first month,” Cyrus rested his elbow on the table and smiled. TJ slightly blushed. He definitely wasn’t expecting to talk about his love life with his crush. That just wasn’t supposed to happen.

“W-well, he was always really nice to me, and even though we kept everything lowkey, he still took me out to some really nice places. He was really into astronomy. I remember one time we went to a planetarium together and he would tell me about all the different planets and constellations. I remember going to his grandmother’s house in the countryside and just lying in the grass with him at night, and watching the stars. Wow, sorry this is so gross, hahaha,” TJ realised how much he was rambling. Cyrus had the cutest smile on his face and said, “No, keep going. That sounds amazing.” TJ blushed again and softly chuckled.

“Well it was amazing, not gonna lie. But after that first month, he stopped taking me out. He kinda took really long to reply to my messages, and he always made excuses when I tried to take him out,” TJ’s eyes were fixed on the ant that was crawling across the table. “I remember trying to check his Instagram once, but I found out that he blocked me. I was so confused. I stopped him in the hallway one day to ask him what was going on. Then, another guy walked up to us and kissed him on the cheek. Turned out that he was cheating on me and just decided to find another guy without even having the decency to break up with me first,” TJ’s heart started to beat faster as the feelings of anger and humiliation were beginning to seep in.

“What??? That’s terrible…I’m so sorry he did that to you,” Cyrus placed his hand on TJ’s leg in comfort. TJ turned his head to look at Cyrus and smiled pitifully.

“Yeah…that’s pretty much the reason why I turned into ‘scary-basketball-guy,’” TJ laughed. “I was so deeply hurt that I felt as if I needed to build walls around me so it wouldn’t happen again. I turned into this tough mean guy who everyone was scared of, and while that had its advantages, I still felt really lonely,” TJ sighed, “Until I met you.”

“Wait, what…?” Cyrus stared at TJ with a surprised look. TJ realised what he got himself into. He was about to confess. Well, here goes nothing.

“Uh, well, ever since we became friends, I felt those walls slowly breaking down. I felt that I could be more open around you. I wanted to be around you more and more. And then I realised,” TJ gulped, “that I liked you…more than a friend.”

Cyrus took a couple seconds to register this information, and shook his head.

“Wait…you…like me?” Cyrus couldn’t believe what was happening.

“Yeah.” TJ glanced at Cyrus and could feel the heat in his face.

“That’s crazy…I never thought you’d actually like me back,” Cyrus said sheepishly.

“Like you…back??” TJ slowly turned around in his seat to face Cyrus.

Cyrus softly laughed and took one of TJ’s hands in his.

“Yes,” Cyrus looked TJ in the eye, “and I’d definitely try to be a boyfriend who’s a thousand times better than that Caleb…Well, o-only if you want, of course.”

TJ felt the anger from talking about Caleb blossom into the happiest and warmest feeling he’s felt in a while. TJ smiled widely and held Cyrus’ hand with both of his.

“More than anything.”

The bell signaling the end of lunch rang, and the two boys realised they didn’t even get anything to eat. They laughed, got up from the table and made their way to a vending machine, hand in hand.
